titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, at Bombay to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has resulted in a hole in the fabric of the folio. As a result, a small part of the body of the letter has been obscured.

mods.abstract: The letter concerns a petition from Ahmed Uzem [Aḥmad ‘Aẓīm], in which he claimed that two boats captured by Captain Sumley of HMS Topazewere in fact his property. It explains that the claim is truthful, and that the Resident has made arrangements for the boats to be restored to him.
